item.title: S. 349, Susquehanna Gateway National Heritage Area Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on July 21, 2010

item.title: S. 349, Susquehanna Gateway National Heritage Area Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on July 21, 2010

summary.text: Susquehanna Gateway National Heritage Area Act - Establishes the Susquehanna Gateway National Heritage Area in Pennsylvania. Designates the Lancaster-York Heritage Region as the management entity for the Area. Requires the Lancaster-York Heritage Region to prepare and submit a management plan for the Area.

Susquehanna Gateway National Heritage Area Act - Establishes the Susquehanna Gateway National Heritage Area in Pennsylvania. Requires the inclusion of Lancaster and York Counties within the boundaries of the Area.

Designates the Susquehanna Heritage Corporation as the local coordinating entity for the Area.

Prohibits the Corporation from using federal funds under this Act for the acquisition of real property or any interest in real property.

Requires the Corporation to prepare and submit a management plan for the Area and sets forth procedures for its approval or disapproval.

Authorizes appropriations. Limits the federal cost share for any activity carried out using funds under this Act to half of that activity's cost.

Terminates the authority of the Secretary of the Interior to provide financial assistance under this Act 15 years after its enactment.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
